title: Which is the most accepted atomic structure? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a key point about the Bohr model that is no longeraccepted in current models of theatom. In the Bohr model, the electrons are still thought to orbit the nucleus just like planets orbit the sun. Actually, this is something that we can not say is true.

That depends on what you are trying to do . . . Letters and numbers are just fine for writing and balancing chemical equations. The ‘ball-and-stick’ model works well for teaching and exploring general chemistry concepts. Models involving bond angles and energies become more important when exploring rates of chemical reactions. For detailed knowledge of processes and intermediates you will probably have to dive headfirst into the abyss of physical chemistry. Have you asked your question of Wikipedia?
